name: Rep. Mondaire Jones
tweet_text: Judiciary employees should not have to rely on the goodwill of the judges they work for. They should be able to count on a transparent, reliable system of enforceable rights and robust remedies. In other words, a legal system ‚Äì like the one they help judges administer every day.

tweet_text: This is a clear failure of the current system meant to hold judges accountable. The judiciary terminated its investigation into Judge Kozinski and never initiated one into Judge Reinhardt, even after the brave public testimony of some of the women those judges harassed.

name: Rep. Mondaire Jones
tweet_text:
A7: In communities with small-donor matching programs, candidates spend more time engaging everyday people about the issues that matter to them and less time asking wealthy donors for money.

This is about creating a government that is truly by and for We, the People. #S1TownHall https://t.co/huCp0NXHmE

name: Rep. Mondaire Jones
tweet_text:
A6: Congress isn‚Äôt just funded by wealthy people ‚Äî it‚Äôs full of them. This is because our broken campaign finance system is rigged to favor wealthy candidates.

Small-donor financing gives power back to the people so they can help elect the candidates that truly represent them. https://t.co/vytEq5uiLc

name: Rep. Mondaire Jones
tweet_text:
To build a true democracy, we need to make sure that our politicians listen to us, the people ‚Äî not just their biggest donors. 

With small-donor matching, candidates who have historically been excluded from electoral politics can run people-powered campaigns and win. #S1TownHall https://t.co/yggIGNSWFO

name: Rep. Mondaire Jones
tweet_text: A4: The small-donor matching program in #S1 doesn‚Äôt use a single taxpayer dollar. Instead, the program is funded entirely by fines and penalties paid by big corporations who break the law. It‚Äôs a win-win. #S1TownHall https://t.co/z1TDgjzRev

name: Rep. Mondaire Jones
tweet_text:
A3: Small-donor matching is simple: for every dollar a person donates up to $200, public financing matches that dollar with $6. 

That means a $50 donation becomes a $350 donation, giving small-dollar donors the power to make a real difference in our elections. #S1TownHall https://t.co/4hLU0iO17M

name: Rep. Mondaire Jones
tweet_text:
Too often, big-dollar donors drive the outcome of so many elections, helping the wealthy and well-connected control our government. 

By establishing public campaign financing, the #ForThePeopleAct would help elect more working people, women, people of color, and young people. https://t.co/Wgqdpws5DH

name: Rep. Mondaire Jones
